DalekJS.name: DalekJS
DalekJS.description:
This module is a browser plugin for [DalekJS](//github.com/dalekjs/dalek).
It provides all a WebDriverServer & browser launcher for Safari on iOS.

At the moment this only works with the IPhone 

The browser plugin can be installed with the following command:

```bash
$ npm install dalek-browser-ios --save-dev
```

You can use the browser plugin by adding a config option to the your Dalekfile

```javascript
"browsers": ["ios"]
```

Or you can tell Dalek that it should test in this browser via the command line:

```bash
$ dalek mytest.js -b ios
```

The Webdriver Server tries to open Port 9003 by default,
if this port is blocked, it tries to use a port between 9004 & 9093
You can specifiy a different port from within your [Dalekfile](/pages/config.html) like so:

```javascript
"browsers": {
  "ios": {
    "port": 5555 
  }
}
```

It is also possible to specify a range of ports:

```javascript
"browsers": {
  "ios": {
    "portRange": [6100, 6120] 
  }
}
```

If you would like to test on the IPad (IPhone) emulator, you can simply apply a snd. argument,
which defines the browser type:

```bash
$ dalek mytest.js -b ios:ipad
```

Browser.IosDriver.name: Browser.IosDriver
Browser.IosDriver.description:
This module is a browser plugin for [DalekJS](//github.com/dalekjs/dalek).
It provides all a WebDriverServer & browser launcher for Safari on iOS.

At the moment this only works with the IPhone 

The browser plugin can be installed with the following command:

```bash
$ npm install dalek-browser-ios --save-dev
```

You can use the browser plugin by adding a config option to the your Dalekfile

```javascript
"browsers": ["ios"]
```

Or you can tell Dalek that it should test in this browser via the command line:

```bash
$ dalek mytest.js -b ios
```

The Webdriver Server tries to open Port 9003 by default,
if this port is blocked, it tries to use a port between 9004 & 9093
You can specifiy a different port from within your [Dalekfile](/pages/config.html) like so:

```javascript
"browsers": {
  "ios": {
    "port": 5555 
  }
}
```

It is also possible to specify a range of ports:

```javascript

  "ios": {
    "portRange": [6100, 6120]

```

If you would like to test on the IPad (IPhone) emulator, you can simply apply a snd. argument,
which defines the browser type:

```bash
$ dalek mytest.js -b ios:ipad
```

classitems.description:
Tag-closer extension for CodeMirror.

This extension adds an "autoCloseTags" option that can be set to
either true to get the default behavior, or an object to further
configure its behavior.

These are supported options:

`whenClosing` (default true)
  Whether to autoclose when the '/' of a closing tag is typed.
`whenOpening` (default true)
  Whether to autoclose the tag when the final '>' of an opening
  tag is typed.
`dontCloseTags` (default is empty tags for HTML, none for XML)
  An array of tag names that should not be autoclosed.
`indentTags` (default is block tags for HTML, none for XML)
  An array of tag names that should, when opened, cause a
  blank line to be added inside the tag, and the blank line and
  closing line to be indented.

See demos/closetag.html for a usage example.
Verbose version of the browser name
classitems.name: longName

classitems.description:
Default port of the Appium WebDriverServer
The port may change, cause the port conflict resolution
tool might pick another one, if the default one is blocked
classitems.name: port

classitems.description: WebHook port
classitems.name: webhookPort

classitems.description:
Default host of the Appium WebDriverServer
The host may be overridden with
a user configured value
classitems.name: host

classitems.description: Root path of the appium webdriver server
classitems.name: path

classitems.description:
Default desired capabilities that should be
transferred when the browser session gets requested
classitems.name: desiredCapabilities

classitems.description: Driver defaults, what should the driver be able to access.
classitems.name: driverDefaults

classitems.description:
Special arguments that are needed to invoke
appium. These are the defaults, they need to be modified later on
classitems.name: appiumArgs

classitems.description: Different browser types (iPhone / iPad)
classitems.name: browserTypes

classitems.description: IPad emulator
classitems.name: ipad

classitems.description: Resolves the driver port
classitems.name: getPort

classitems.description: Resolves the maximum range for the driver port
classitems.name: getMaxPort

return.description: port Max WebDriver server port range

classitems.description: Resolves the webhook port
classitems.name: getWebhookPort

classitems.description: Resolves the maximum range for the webhook port
classitems.name: getWebhookPort

classitems.description: Returns the driver host
classitems.name: getHost

classitems.description:
Launches appium & corresponding emulator or device,
kicks off the portscanner
classitems.name: launch

classitems.description:
Kills the Appium Server process,
kills simulator processses
with a slight timeout to prevent 
appium from throwing errors
classitems.name: kill

classitems.description:
Kills the non blacklisted simulator processes & restores
the stderr handler
classitems.name: _kill

params.name: result
params.description: List of currently running simulator processes

classitems.description:
Checks a blacklist & kills the process when
not found
classitems.name: _killProcess

classitems.description:
Checks & switches the appium server port,
scans the range for the webhook port
classitems.name: _listProcesses

classitems.description:
Checks & switches the webhook port,
loads a list of running simulator processes
classitems.name: _listProcesses

classitems.description:
Stores open processes,
suppresses stdout logs,
starts appium
classitems.name: _listProcesses

params.name: result
params.description: List of currently running simulator processes

classitems.description:
Stores the appium server reference,
restores the stdout logs
classitems.name: _afterAppiumStarted

classitems.description: Configures appium
classitems.name: _loadAppiumArgs

classitems.description: Process user defined ports
classitems.name: _checkUserDefinedPorts

classitems.description: Process user defined appium ports
classitems.name: _checkAppiumPorts

classitems.description: Process user defined webhook ports
classitems.name: _checkWebhookPorts

classitems.description: Tracks running simulator processes
classitems.name: _processes

classitems.description:
Transforms the process list output into
a json structure
classitems.name: _transformProcesses

params.name: err
params.description: Error if error, null if not

classitems.description: Scans and transforms the process list
classitems.name: _scanProcess

classitems.description: Filters process list items
classitems.name: _filterProcessItem

classitems.description:
Overwrite default stdout & stderr handler
to suppress some appium logs
classitems.name: _suppressAppiumLogs

classitems.description:
Reinstantiate stdout handler after appium has
been started
classitems.name: _reinstantiateLog
